CSSMax-inline-size.summary: The max-inline-size CSS property defines the horizontal or vertical maximum size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode. It corresponds to either the max-width or the max-height property, depending on the value of writing-mode.

remarks.para: If the writing mode is vertically oriented, the value of max-inline-size relates to the maximal height of the element; otherwise, it relates to the maximal width of the element. A related property is max-block-size, which defines the other dimension of the element.

-The mapped physical properties: max-width and max-height
-writing-mode

CSSMax-inline-size.value: The max-inline-size property takes the same values as the max-width and max-height properties.
